alert.note: Alert for Adams; Arapahoe; Denver; Douglas (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 06 at 4:35PM MDT until June 06 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver Colorado has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Douglas County in northeastern Colorado... Western Arapahoe County in northeastern Colorado... Eastern Denver County in northeastern Colorado... Western Adams County in northeastern Colorado... * Until 530 PM MDT. * At 434 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were developing along a line extending from 4 miles south of Barr Lake to Castle Rock, or along a line extending from 14 miles northeast of Denver to 35 miles north of Colorado Springs, and are nearly stationary. HAZARD...Half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. Hail may accumulate on roadways causing hazardous travel. * Locations impacted include... Eastern Denver, Aurora, Centennial, eastern Highlands Ranch, Castle Rock, northeastern Commerce City, Parker, Brighton, Greenwood Village, Lone Tree, Denver International Airport, D.I.A Terminal and Concourses, The Pinery, Arapahoe Park, Franktown, Castle Pines, Buckley SFB, Barr Lake and Sedalia. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
